title: Timeline of investigations into Donald Trump and Russia (January–June 2017)
added: ** The Senate Intelligence Committee interviews Brennan.<ref name=SenatIntelCommitReportVol1>{{Cite web |title=Report of the Select Committee on Intelligence United States Senate on Russian Active Measures Campaigns and Interference in the U.S. Election Volume 1: Russian Efforts Against Election Infrastructure with Additional Views |url=https://www.intelligence.senate.gov/sites/default/files/documents/Report_Volume1.pdf |format=PDF |website=[[United States Senate]] |author=Select Committee on Intelligence |author-link=Select Committee on Intelligence |date=July 2019 |access-date=September 17, 2020}}</ref>{{rp|7, 39}}

title: Timeline of investigations into Donald Trump and Russia (January–June 2017)
added: * '''April 27''': Facebook releases a [[whitepaper]] entitled "Information Operations and Facebook"<ref>{{Cite web |title=Information Operations and Facebook |url=https://fbnewsroomus.files.wordpress.com/2017/04/facebook-and-information-operations-v1.pdf |website=[[Facebook]] |date=April 27, 2017 |access-date=September 20, 2020 |last1=Weedon |first1=Jen |last2=Nuland |first2=William |last3=Stamos |first3=Alex |author-link3=Alex Stamos}}</ref> that describes malicious information operations and actors on the platform.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Facebook says it will act against 'information operations' using false accounts |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-facebook-propaganda-response-idUSKBN17T2G6 |website=[[Reuters]] |date=April 27, 2017 |access-date=September 20, 2020 |last1=Menn |first1=Joseph |editor-last1=Rigby |editor-first1=Bill |editor-last2=McCool |editor-first2=Grant}}</ref>{{r|SenatIntelCommitReportVol2|p=76}}
